intro: Schoepfia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved schoepfia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
